definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
to absolve sb from guilt/to exonerate/to exculpate

sentences.english: He made up a story to explain his absence.
sentences.chinese: 他編造謊言爲他的缺席開脫。

sentences.english: But there is a troubling subtext: the author’s attempts to exculpate himself.
sentences.chinese: 不過令人煩惱的是，作者總打算替自己開脫。

sentences.english: After all, Dooku was too dangerous to be taken alive, rationalized Palpatine.
sentences.chinese: 畢竟，杜庫太危險了，不能活捉，帕爾帕廷爲他開脫。

sentences.english: However, the Bush administration has its own exonerations and explanations.
sentences.chinese: 然而，布什政府則對其行爲有責自己的解釋和開脫。

sentences.english: Whitman was cleared of the conflict by the EPA inspector general.
sentences.chinese: 環境署監察長使惠特曼從以權謀私的指責中得以開脫。

sentences.english: Second, it absolves voters of responsibility for their problems.
sentences.chinese: 其次，民粹主義爲選民自身的責任開脫。

sentences.english: This argument is only too blatantly an alibi for domestic repression.
sentences.chinese: 這一辯解完全是在爲國內的鎮壓活動開脫。

sentences.english: Set a good time, the phone will be sounded, who slipped to absolve.
sentences.chinese: 設定好時間，手機就會響起來，開脫溜身之用。

sentences.english: Edison rushed out and carried the boy to safety.
sentences.chinese: 愛迪生衝上去把孩子抱開脫了險。

sentences.english: The fact that the man has performed no action does not excuse him.
sentences.chinese: 雖然這個人什麼都沒有做，但他並不能因此開脫罪責。

sentences.english: For absolving Song escort department want and the scapegoat are made by him actually.
sentences.chinese: 爲了開脫宋押司硬是要把他做替罪羊。

sentences.english: The king asked her this is for Chu Beijie excuse?
sentences.chinese: 晉王問她這是要替楚北捷開脫嗎？
